alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:32PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN COOK, SOUTHEASTERN ST. LOUIS AND CENTRAL LAKE COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 231 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Forest Center, to 9 miles southwest of Whyte, to 9 miles northeast of Boulder Lake, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Forest Center around 235 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Whyte, Two Harbors, Highland Lake and Thomas Lake Near Brimson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore
